newsitem.title: USA: Datastream to buy SQL Systems for $34 million.
newsitem.headline: Datastream to buy SQL Systems for $34 million.

text.p: Datastream Systems Inc. said Monday it has a definitive agreement to buy SQL Systems Group BV, another developer of software that prevents equipment failures, for about $34 million.
Half of the payment will be in cash and half in stock.
Datastream said it will take major charges for the purchase, restructuring, and in-process research and development in the fourth quarter.
The acquisition of SQL, based in Rotterdam, Netherlands, should boost 1997 earnings if the the two companies' operations can be effectively combined on schedule, Datastream said.
The deal is expected to close before the end of 1996.
Greenville, S.C. based Datastream's stock fell 87.5 cents to $21.625 on Nasdaq at midday.
